1.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
properly, to dawn, i.e. (figuratively) be (up) early at any task (with the implication of earnestness); by extension, to search for (with painstaking)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen

2.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
properly, to address in aloud tone, i.e. (specifically) loud; figuratively, to pacify (as if by words)

4.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power

5.brief: a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
fat, whether literally or figuratively; hence, the richest or choice part
the fat; abstractly fatness, i.e. (figuratively) abundance; specifically the (fatty) ashes of sacrifices
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

6.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
spread, i.e. a bed; (architecture) an extension, i.e. wing or lean-to (a single story or collectively)
to murmur (in pleasure or anger); by implication, to ponder

7.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle
properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)

8.brief: properly, to impinge, i.e. cling or adhere; figuratively, to catch by pursuit
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
to sustain; by implication, to obtain, keep fast; figuratively, to help, follow close
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south

9.brief: to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
lowermost; as noun (feminine plural) the depths (figuratively, a pit, the womb)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

10.brief: to flow; figuratively, to stretch out; causatively, to pour out or down; figuratively, to deliver over
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
an allotment (by courtesy, law or providence)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

11.brief: probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to seven oneself, i.e. swear (as if by repeating a declaration seven times)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to shut up; by implication, to surrender
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)
